Directions: Base your answer to the following question on the diagram below and on your knowledge of science.
Content: The diagram represents a laboratory setup used to study heat transfer. Two covered, insulated cups, A and B, are connected with an aluminum bar. Each cup contains the same amount of water, but the water has different starting temperatures. The water in cup A had a starting temperature of 100°C. The water in cup B had a starting temperature of 20°C. The graph shows the changes in the water temperatures over a 20-minute period.
